intro: Jupunba curvicarpa var. curvicarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit jupunba, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces dark blue to black berries that are edible and often used in local cuisines. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
